lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Wing Chun master: _Ip Man_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/ipman/IpMan.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run ipman.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something.

* Represents a task with a deadline.
* Extends the Task class to include a due date and time.
* Provides methods to format and display the deadline.
* Constructs a Deadline task with a specified description and due date.
* @param description The name or description of the deadline task.
* @param stringDate The due date and time in the format "DD/MM/YYYY hh[0-23]mm".
* @throws CommandException If the date format is incorrect.
public Deadline(String description, String stringDate) throws CommandException {
throw new CommandException("Please format the datetime string as follows: DD/MM/YYYY hh[0-23]mm");
* Represents an event task with a start and end time.
* Extends the Task class to include the event duration.
* Provides methods to format and display the event details.
* Constructs an Event task with a specified description, start time, and end time.
* @param description The name or description of the event.
* @param from The start time of the event.
* @param to The end time of the event.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* The entry point class for the chatbot
* This class initializes the task list, storage, user interface, and parser.
* It also contains the main method to run the chatbot.

* @param filePath The path to save state
* The main method to run the chatbot.
* If a test argument is provided, it runs without persistence.
* Otherwise, it runs with persistence using the specified file path.
boolean isTest = args.length > 0 && args[0] != null && Boolean.parseBoolean(args[0]);

* Parses user input and executes commands.
* This class interacts with the task list, storage, and user interface.
* It processes commands to manage tasks and handles input from various sources.
* Constructs a Parser with the specified task list, storage, and user interface.
* @param db The storage for saving and loading tasks.
* @param ui The user interface for interacting with the user.
public Parser(ArrayList<Task> taskList, Storage db, Ui ui) {

ui.addToBuffer("Now you have " + taskList.size() + " tasks in the list.");
ui.addToBuffer("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");

* This class provides methods to read from and write to a file.
* It supports both temporary and specified file storage.
* Constructs a Storage instance using a temporary file.
* The temporary file is created with a unique name based on the current timestamp.
* Constructs a Storage instance using a specified file path.
* If the file does not exist, it is created along with any necessary parent directories.
* @param filePath The path of the file to use for storage.
* Adds a new entry to the storage file.
* The entry is appended to the end of the file.
* @param str The data to be added to the file.
* Returns a Scanner to read from the storage file.
* The caller is responsible for closing the Scanner.
* @return A Scanner to read from the file.
* @throws RuntimeException If the file is not found.
* Represents a task with a description and completion status.
* Provides methods to mark and unmark the task as done.
* This class serves as a base class for specific types of tasks.
* Constructs a Task with the specified description.
* The task is initially not done.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Sets the task to not done
* @return The new string representation of the task
* @return The new string representation of the task
* Extends the Task class to provide a specific type of task.
* Provides a method to display the todo task details.
* Constructs a Todo task with a specified description.
* @param description The name or description of the todo task.
* This class provides methods to display messages and manage output buffers.
* It includes functionality to print banners, separators, and buffered messages.
System.out.println("Hello from Ip Man!\nWhat can I do for you?");
* The separator line is defined by the SEPARATOR constant.
* Adds a string to the output buffer.
* The string is appended to the current buffer content.
* @param str The string to add to the buffer.
* Outputs the buffer content to the screen and clears the buffer.
* If the buffer is not empty, it prints the buffer content followed by a separator line.
